HI!

I was thinking about making a new PC on Arelith Server. (max lvl 30)
I'd like it to be a Drow (+2INT +2CHA) Stalker who Hunts foes in underdark and even Surface. 
I imagine it stealthy and capable of well disguising ( HIgh Trick skill). I was considering as classes Rogue, monk, and even Warlock (I like the idea to hunt for souls too) but i have no idea how to build it to be valuable.

I'd like him to be mostly PVP.

I report down here the new Warlock mechanics to aid the buildrs:

Bard Base- Loses Bard Song and acess to Curse song. All other skills and feats available remain the same except...

- Must be Non-Good
- Gains d8 rather than d6 HP per level
- Gains Uncanny Dodge at level 10, 5/- damage resistance at level 20, and 10/- at level 30 to all physical types (piercing/slashing/bludgeoning)
- 5/10/15 DR at the above levels to two elements (Acid and Fire for Fiends, Cold and Electricity for Fey)
- Innate -20% Arcane Spell failure (Other Spell Failure reducing Medium armour and Large Shields are available too)
- Warlocks have unlimited spells per day, with no cooldown and whenever the Warlock casts a spell that targets a hostile opponent, unless it's a Charm/Dominate spell - they do 1d4/level damage (applying only to the direct target of the spell, casting Confusion will deal damage to the target and force them and everyone around them to make a save or be affected, but only the main target takes damage) of an element depending on the pact. Fey Warlocks can pick and switch between Magic, Cold and Electrical damage while Fiends have Magic, Fire and Acid.
-All spells otherwise work as normal when cast on the floor or party members. When cast directly on hostiles the target has to fail a touch attack roll, otherwise they avoid both the damage and the spell itself!

posts.author: Rua Blackmist
posts.content:
I do not think I can help you with a build, but I can hopefully give you an opinion a bit higher (with the warlocks, from my own personal experience with them). Fey, is mostly for parties, the buffs and such. With unlimited casting, it's a good thing. Daze if you stay a warlock would do roughly 80 damage at 20 and 120 at 30 (Maximum as it is a 1d4 * Warlock Levels). Note that the DC of the spell will rise with your levels in Warlock (Bard). Please note that Summon I summons the equivalent of a Summon Creature III which is the Worg of you which you speak  (The Underdark version of the Surface level 3). Conjuration, Greater Conjuration, and Epic. Let's a Level 1 summon spell reach Level's 2, 3, and 4 Respectively. (Unknown if Conjuration affects Warlock as I never took it. So, ...use at own risk?) A disadvantage is that you are limited to only the spells you see within the list. You cannot use 'anything' you want. It is all pretty much determined.

Though, Tasha's laughter gets...really overpowered in my personal opinion (making super hard things at low levels become child's play.)

A good place to stop on Warlock levels (if you want other classes) Should not really be before level 20 at most, so that you get the maximum amount of effectiveness. However, it can really be cast aside any time you want, though I would highly recommend 20 levels at least, regardless, of choosing order.. (Especially for the Fey path). Fey is more Support. Abyssal/Fiend is more 'offensive'. Each has its own unique strengths and weaknesses. But, both sides are highly viable. I will let the experts, however, give you a proper build. (As they might know how to meld it better with other classes instead of straight up pure warlock.

posts.author: HipRedux
posts.content:
Not crazy about that warlock class.  It seems that most of the better spells & buffs become available after at least 15 levels of warlock which means your melee killing power will be severely gimped.  Bards are really not very impressive spellcasters to begin with.  They mostly have stripped down repertoire of mages plus some divine influence for party buffing.  Their real strength is in their song(s) and those are eliminated for this custom class.

I was thinking more along the lines of a DEX-based rogue/assassin with Epic Dodge as early as possible, hopefully Level 27 though haven't tried to piece one together.  The sneaks and death attacks will stack and assassin gets access to spells that cannot be dispelled. Am even considering BG in there pre-epic for a boost to the BAB, better weapon selection and seeing as how the drow reaps a CHA benefit... well, like I said, in passing by this was what occurred to me first.  Dunno if it is even feasible on Arelith.
